item.description: A little bit of Souls Of Inspyration and a whole lot of Traffic, amongst other things.

item.title: Broadcast on 13 September, 2007
item.description: Rants by me! Rants by Bill Bissett! An entire Collectors album side! Yeah!
item.itunes:subtitle: All CanCon show

item.title: Broadcast on 06 September, 2007
item.description: Olde English Folk, general accoustic hippiness, and the return of Deconstructing Jimmy Page.
item.itunes:subtitle: Getting our heads together in the country

item.title: Broadcast on 03 September, 2007
item.description: Fill-in for Alex Ushijima on Monday the 3rd - basically a timeline through British indie pop from C86 to Shoegazing.
item.itunes:subtitle: At Last The 1990 Show

item.title: Broadcast on 30 August, 2007
item.description:
It's just about Labour Day weekend, so maybe have a listen to tonight's show with features on J.K. & Co., The Plastic Cloud, and Tomorrow while you fish your fall/winter wardrobe out of storage.

armeniacity@hotmail.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Goodbye summer

item.title: Broadcast on 23 August, 2007
item.description: I try out a new segment called Deconstructing Jimmy Page, where we investigate songs he's ripped off. Dazeed & Confused runs long and gets cut off.
item.itunes:subtitle: Happy Birthday To Me

item.title: Broadcast on 09 August, 2007
item.description: A special 3-hour broadcast because Bleek took the night off.
item.itunes:subtitle: It was a 3-hour tour...

item.title: Broadcast on 02 August, 2007
item.description:
We start off with Oh No, but from then on it's 100% Canadian Content to start your BC Day long weekend right.
armeniacity@hotmail.com http://www.myspace.com/stereoscopicredoubt
item.itunes:subtitle: Canada Reprazent

item.title: Broadcast on 26 July, 2007
item.description: The sun's finally back from a couple of weeks off, so let's listen to some stuff from the West Coast. HP Lovecraft finally gets a spin, too.
item.itunes:subtitle: Anthem Of The Sun

item.title: Broadcast on 25 July, 2007
item.description: This isn't the normal show, it's a fill-in I did for my friend Anita. Might be worth a listen if'n you want to hear DOA, King Sunny Ade, Marianne Mendt, Cub, and Lawrence Welk on the same setlist...
item.itunes:subtitle: Fill-in for Samsquatch's Hideaway

item.title: Broadcast on 19 July, 2007
item.description: I play a whack of stuff inspired by the glory days of psych/garage, including The Thanes, Black Tambourine, The Stone Roses, Primal Scream, and The House Of Love.
item.itunes:subtitle: Son of Psych

item.title: Broadcast on 12 July, 2007
item.description: Start off with some Jeff Beck for Scotty Hall (1955-2006), then get into some new acquisitions by The Folklords and Mother Tucker's Yellow Duck. I did some more LP-CD transferring this weekend and throw some Humans and Warlords into the mix. armeniacity@hotmail.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Something for Scotty

item.title: Broadcast on 05 July, 2007
item.description: A spotlight on The Collectors and a set of obscure sitar-flavoured classics.
item.itunes:subtitle: Collectable Sitars

item.title: Broadcast on 28 June, 2007
item.description: After taking a relaxed attitude towards thinking up a setlist this week, I run a couple of 12-minute songs by The Blues Project and Mock Duck to fill a 30-minute gap in the show's running order this week.
item.itunes:subtitle: Wot, it's Thursday already?

item.title: Broadcast on 21 June, 2007
item.description:
...with psychedelic shotguns.
The Yesterdais move into Studio A and start telling me what to play. Lots of Stones, Syd Barrett, and some boss stuff by The Eyes are on the agenda, so I don't mind. If you listen carefully, you can hear the colour of Thomas' suit.
www.myspace.com/stereoscopicredoubt armeniacity@hotmail.com
item.itunes:subtitle: It's a fuzzed-out equinox rave-up with The Yesterdais...

item.title: Broadcast on 14 June, 2007
item.description: Jimi Hendrix! Big Brother & The Holding Company! The Byrds! The Who! Otis Redding! Laura Nyro! Quicksilver Messenger Service! Hugh Masakela! Electric Flag! Moby Grape! Eric Burdon & The Animals! The Grateful Dead! Et cetera!
item.itunes:subtitle: Monterey Pop Festival 40th anniversary special

item.title: Broadcast on 08 June, 2007
item.description:
We start the month of June by resurrecting a local Krautrock classic from Pipedream, then feature some demo material from The Rocking Horse People's forthcoming album. Choas ensues.
by the way, for setlists and info, why not visit http://www.myspace.com/stereoscopicredoubt, or e-mail me at armeniacity@hotmail.com
item.itunes:subtitle: June's busting out all over

item.title: Broadcast on 31 May, 2007
item.description: We bring the first month of the show to a close with a tasty selection featuring Apples In Stereo, The Orange Alabaster Mushroom, The West Coast Pop Art Experimental Band, and Felius Andromeda.
item.itunes:subtitle: Games for May

item.title: Broadcast on 24 May, 2007
item.description: Four brand news tracks by The Yesterdais featured, and a brief trip through Yorkville Village with Bent Wind and Kensington Market.
item.itunes:subtitle: Tomorrow's Yesterdais, Today

item.title: Broadcast on 17 May, 2007
item.description: Special show featuring acts from Japan, India, Cambodia, Korea, Lebanon, Pakistan, Hong Kong, and Turkey.
item.itunes:subtitle: Asian History Month Extravaganza!

item.title: Broadcast on 10 May, 2007
item.description: Brand new tracks by The Yesterdais, The Sparkling Fountains Of Magic Reality and The Laurels, plus a spotlight on vintage Australian psychedelia.
item.itunes:subtitle: Downunder Dreamtime

item.title: Broadcast on May 3rd
item.description: First broadcast of new show focusing on psych/garage... some things old, some things new... something Lebanese...
item.itunes:subtitle: The Maiden Voyage
